decks.notes: This Mono White Control deck focuses on using a combination of removal spells, life gain, and board wipes to control the game and outlast the opponent. The deck includes cards like The Eternal Wanderer and Archangel Elspeth for strong defense, along with cards like Caretaker's Talent and Beza, the Bounding Spring for card advantage and resource management. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up its own board presence and eventually overpowering them through attrition and incremental advantages.

This Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on early creature aggression and disruption, utilizing cards like Preacher of the Schism and Deep-Cavern Bat to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. It also includes cards like Temporary Lockdown and Virtue of Persistence to control the board and maintain pressure. Liliana of the Veil and Go for the Throat provide removal options, while Virtue of Loyalty boosts your creatures' power. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to flood the board with low-cost aggressive creatures and utilize burn spells to control the tempo of the game. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats while also being able to quickly finish off the opponent with direct damage from spells. The combination of fast creatures, burn spells, and efficient mana base allows this deck to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with creatures like Azure Beastbinder and Lord Skitter, Sewer King, and using cards like Cut Down and Go for the Throat to control the opponent's board. Nezumi Informant and Vren, the Relentless provide card advantage and disruption. Karumonix, the Rat King creates tokens to overwhelm the opponent. Cavern of Souls ensures creatures resolve successfully, while lands like Lilypad Village and Mudflat Village help maintain mana consistency. Overall, the strategy is to apply aggressive pressure while controlling the opponent's options for a fast win.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board and the opponent's actions using a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage engines. By efficiently removing threats with removal spells like Abrade and Lightning Helix, countering spells with Deduce and Three Steps Ahead, and generating card advantage with cards like Saheeli, Filigree Master and Ral, Crackling Wit, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through incremental advantage. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent access to all spells.

This deck focuses on using small, evasive creatures and cheap removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and win the game. By playing aggressive creatures like Azure Beastbinder and Persistent Marshstalker early on, combined with cards like Anoint with Affliction and Go for the Throat to deal with threats, the deck aims to maintain board control and push through damage efficiently. The inclusion of Lord Skitter, Sewer King and Karumonix, the Rat King adds synergy and allows for powerful combos that can rapidly close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing board control and applying pressure on the opponent through a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing a mix of efficient creatures, tempo plays, and evasion effects, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The key strategy is to maintain a steady flow of threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately leading to a quick victory through aggressive combat and resource denial.
